meanings.definition: To write or print in the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent1: I will romanise this text for easier reading.
meanings.sent2: She decided to romanise the ancient script for the museum display.
meanings.sent3: The computer tried to romanise the alien language but ended up with gibberish.
meanings.sent4: His love for Latin culture led him to romanise all his notes.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to romanise their names on the paper.

meanings.definition: To convert text into the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent1: Can you romanise this document into English?
meanings.sent2: The software can romanise the text from French to Spanish.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to romanise the spell into a different language.
meanings.sent4: She had to romanise the ancient manuscript to understand its contents.
meanings.sent5: The translator will romanise the text for the international audience.

meanings.definition: To make something Roman in character or style.
meanings.sent1: The architect wanted to romanise the building with columns and arches.
meanings.sent2: They decided to romanise the garden to resemble a Roman villa.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to romanise the dish by adding Roman spices.
meanings.sent4: The designer aimed to romanise the fashion show with togas and laurel wreaths.
meanings.sent5: The artist sought to romanise the painting by incorporating Roman motifs.
